entry.title: Tools of Visual Studio Code
entry.summary:
This note will be consistently updated.
Shortcuts
Command + k Command + s: Keyboard Shortcuts
Command + p: Go to file Command + Shift + o: Go to symbol in editor Command + t: Go to symbol in workspace Command + Shift + f: Search in workspace Command + Shift + p: input command Command + Shift + n: New window Command + o: Open Command + ,: Settings Control + `: Terminal ...

entry.title: Information Design in Multi-Agent Reinforcement Learning

link.title: Information Design in Multi-Agent Reinforcement Learning

entry.summary:
Key Points
Mixed-motive between two agents. Some other MARL papers use the term “mixed-motive” to describe scenarios involving two groups of agents, where agents within the same group cooperate but have conflicts with agents from the other group. Non-stationarity.
Signals should not be viewed as actions. Signals affects the others’ “environment”.
Signaling Gradie...

entry.title: Policy Distillation
entry.summary:
Introduction [Paper]: Policy Distillation
The following statements from the paper are key to understand this technique:
Distillation is a method to transfer knowledge from a teacher model $T$ to a student model $S$. Goals:
It is “used to extract the policy of a reinforcement learning agent and train a new network that performs at the expert level while being dramatically smalle...

entry.title: Rational Emotive Behavior Therapy (REBT)
entry.summary:
Introduction
Rational Emotive Behavior Therapy is a form of psychotherapy that helps you identify self-defeating thoughts and feelings, challenge the nature of irrational and unproductive feelings, and replace them with healthier, more productive beliefs. — From the website “Psychology Today”.
Theoretical Assumptions
The REBT framework posits that humans have both innate rational (m...
